question: what is aws appsync?
answer: aws appsync is a new service that enables developers to manage and synchronize mobile app data in real time across devices and users, but still allows the data to be accessed and altered when the mobile device is in an offline state

question: what application developer languages are supported in aws appsync?
answer: aws appsync sdks support ios, android, and javascript

question: can i make my data real-time with aws appsync?
answer: yes, subscriptions are supported with aws appsync against any of the data sources, so that when a mutation occurs, the results can be passed down to clients subscribing to the event stream immediately using either mqtt over websockets or pure websockets

question: what aws regions are available for aws appsync?
answer: aws appsync is available in different regions around the globe, please refer to the aws regions table for more details

question: what is aws cloud9?
answer: aws cloud9 is a cloud-based integrated development environment (ide) that lets you write, run, and debug your code with just a browser

question: who should use aws cloud9?
answer: anybody who writes code can use aws cloud9

question: which programming languages are supported?
answer: aws cloud9 supports over 40 programming languages, including node

question: what web browsers can i use to access aws cloud9?
answer: aws cloud9 is fully supported on the recent versions of google chrome, safari, firefox, and microsoft edge

question: what is the pricing for aws cloud9?
answer: there is no additional charge for aws cloud9

question: what are the other ides supported by aws?
answer: aws offers a broad selection of ide support to facilitate development of applications for aws to learn more about the ide toolkits supported by aws, visit the ide toolkits section on the aws tools page

question: what if i see an error when working with aws cloud9?
answer: you can find some of the errors you might encounter and their possible solutions in the troubleshooting topic of our user guide

question: how do i get started with aws cloud9?
answer: you can sign in to the aws management console, and select aws cloud9

question: what is an aws cloud9 development environment?
answer: an aws cloud9 development environment is where the project code files are stored and the tools used to develop the application are run

question: what are the types of aws cloud9 development environments?
answer: there are two types of aws cloud9 environments that you can use

question: can i use my existing amazon ec2 or amazon lightsail instance with aws cloud9?
answer: yes, you can use ssh environments to connect an existing linux-based ec2 or lightsail instance with aws cloud9

question: how do i edit my code?
answer: the aws cloud9 ide has an advanced code editor with features such as auto-completion, code folding, hinting, syntax highlighting, and line manipulation

question: what tools and packages are preinstalled on aws cloud9 ec2 environments?
answer: aws cloud9 ec2 environments come preinstalled with commonly used development tools such as git and docker

question: how do i run my code?
answer: the aws cloud9 ide has a run button in the toolbar and built-in runners for over 10 different languages that will automatically start your application with the latest code changes

question: how do i run cli commands?
answer: the aws cloud9 ide has a built-in terminal window that can interactively run cli commands

question: how do i connect to source control management systems?
answer: you can open the terminal window within the ide and access your source control system using the same command line tools that you would use on your local machine

question: which aws regions does aws cloud9 support?
answer: see regional products and services for details

question: where does aws cloud9 store my code?
answer: any data that you store in your aws cloud9 environment such as code files, packages, or dependencies is always stored in your resources

question: what are the resources created by aws cloud9 for amazon ec2 environments?
answer: when you create an amazon ec2 environment, aws cloud9 creates the required compute and storage resources in your aws account

question: does aws cloud9 manage resources created in aws cloud9 for amazon ec2 environments?
answer: in addition to creating and deleting your aws cloud9 ec2 environment resources on your behalf, cloud9 can also automatically start and stop the ec2 instances to reduce your costs

question: are my amazon ec2 instances in aws cloud9 environments always running?
answer: no, aws cloud9 provides a default auto-hibernation setting of 30 minutes for your amazon ec2 instances created through cloud9

question: can i change my amazon ec2 instance type for an existing ec2 environment?
answer: yes, you can change the amazon ec2 instance type that you initially selected with your aws cloud9 environment

question: how do i share my aws cloud9 environment with other people?
answer: you can share your aws cloud9 environment by clicking the share button in the top right of your ide

question: can i share an aws cloud9 environment with iam users in a different aws account?
answer: no, aws cloud9 environments can currently be shared only with the iam users within the same aws account

question: how do i access aws services from aws cloud9?
answer: aws cloud9 ec2 environments come preinstalled with the aws cli, which is authenticated with the permissions of the logged-in aws user automatically

question: how can i develop serverless applications for aws lambda using aws cloud9?
answer: you can access the built-in tools for aws lambda from the aws resources panel in the ide

question: can i locally test my aws lambda functions using aws cloud9?
answer: yes, aws cloud9 can simulate the aws lambda execution environment for node

question: how do i use aws cloud9 with aws codestar?
answer: you can launch aws cloud9 environments directly from aws codestar and immediately start editing and committing your codestar project code in the cloud9 ide

question: what is the difference between dedicated and hosted connections?
answer: a dedicated connection is made through a 1 gbps, 10 gbps, or 100 gbps ethernet port dedicated to a single customer

question: how can i get started with aws direct connect?
answer: use the direct connect tab on the aws management console to create a new connection

question: can i use aws direct connect if my network is not present at an aws direct connect location?
answer: yes, direct connect partners can help you extend your preexisting data center or office network to a direct connect location

question: does aws act as my "first mile" or "last mile" provider to connect my on-premises locations to aws?
answer: no, you need to make connections between the local service providers used at your on-premises locations, or work with an aws direct connect delivery partner, to connect to aws direct connect locations

question: what is an aws direct connect gateway?
answer: a direct connect gateway is a grouping of virtual private gateways (vgws) and private virtual interfaces (vifs)

question: what is a virtual interface (vif)?
answer: a virtual interface (vif) is necessary to access aws services, and can be either public or private

question: what is a virtual private gateway (vgw)?
answer: a virtual private gateway (vgw) is part of a vpc that provides edge routing for aws managed vpn connections and direct connect connections

question: what is a link aggregation groups (lag)?
answer: a link aggregation group (lag) is a logical interface that uses the link aggregation control protocol (lacp) to aggregate multiple dedicated connections at a single direct connect endpoint, allowing you to treat them as a single, managed connection

question: what is the aws direct connect resiliency toolkit?
answer: the direct connect resiliency toolkit provides a connection wizard that helps you choose between multiple resiliency models

question: what is the aws direct connect failover testing feature?
answer: the direct connect failover testing feature allows you to test the resiliency of your direct connect connection by disabling the border gateway protocol session between your on-premises networks and aws you can use the aws management console or direct connect application programming interface (api)

question: what are local preference communities for private virtual interfaces (vif)?
answer: the location preference communities for private and transit virtual interfaces provides a feature to let you influence the return path for traffic sources from vpc(s)

question: what is an aws direct connect gateway - bring your own private asn?
answer: configurable private autonomous system number (asn) make it possible to set the asn on the aws side of the bgp session for private or transit vifs on any newly created direct connect gateway

question: what is transit virtual interface?
answer: a transit virtual interface is a type of virtual interface you can create on any direct connect connection with a capacity of 1 gbps or more (1/2/5/10/100 gbps)

question: what is multi-account support for aws direct connect gateway?
answer: multi-account support for direct connect gateway is a feature that allows you to associate up to 10 amazon virtual private clouds (amazon vpcs) or up to three aws transit gateways from multiple aws accounts with a direct connect gateway

question: what is macsec?
answer: 802,1ae mac security (macsec) is an ieee standard that provides data confidentiality, data integrity, and data origin authenticity

question: what is aws direct connect sitelink?
answer: when the sitelink feature is enabled at two or more direct connect locations, you can send data between those locations, bypassing aws regions

question: does having a link aggregation group (lag) make my connection more resilient?
answer: no, a lag doesn't make your connectivity to aws more resilient

question: how do i order connections to aws direct connect for high availability?
answer: we recommend following the resiliency best practices detailed in the direct connect resiliency recommendations page to determine the best resiliency model for your use case

question: does aws direct connect offer a service level agreement (sla)?
answer: yes, direct connect offers an sla

question: when using the failover test feature, can i configure the duration of the test or cancel the test while it's running?
answer: yes, you can configure the duration of the test by setting the minimum and maximum duration for the test to be 1 minute and 180 minutes, respectively

question: can i see my past test history when using the failover test feature? how long do you keep the test history?
answer: yes, you can review your test history using the aws management console or through aws cloudtrail

question: who can initiate a failover test using the aws direct connect resiliency toolkit?
answer: only the owner of the aws account that includes the virtual interface can initiate the test

question: can i delete the virtual interface while the failover test for the same virtual interface is in progress?
answer: yes, you can delete the virtual interface while a test for the same virtual interface is in progress

question: can i run failover tests for any type of virtual interface?
answer: yes, you can run tests for the border gateway protocol session(s) established using any type of virtual interface

question: i have established ipv4 and ipv6 border gateway protocol sessions, can i run this test for each border gateway protocol session?
answer: yes, you can initiate a test for one or both border gateway protocol sessions

question: where and how do i configure sitelink?
answer: you enable and disable sitelink when configuring virtual interfaces (vifs)

question: does sitelink require an aws direct connect gateway connection?
answer: yes, to use sitelink, you must connect sitelink-enabled virtual interfaces (vifs) to an aws direct connect gateway

question: how can i tell what i’m being charged for sitelink?
answer: on billing statements, charges related to sitelink will appear on a separate line from other aws direct connect-related charges

question: what does a simple two-site network architecture look like with sitelink?
answer: to build a simple network, configure a private virtual interface (vif) and enable sitelink on that vif at each site

question: how do i implement a hub-and-spoke architecture with sitelink?
answer: to create a hub-and-spoke architecture, create a direct connect gateway and associate it with all sitelink-enabled private vifs

question: how do i create a segmented network architecture with sitelink?
answer: bring up multiple direct connect gateways, and associate subsets of sitelink-enabled private virtual interfaces (vifs) with each

question: what types of virtual interfaces (vifs) are supported by sitelink?
answer: sitelink is supported on private and transit vifs

question: is bgp required to use sitelink?
answer: yes, sitelink requires bgp

question: does sitelink support ipv6?
answer: yes, sitelink supports ipv6

question: does sitelink support macsec?
answer: yes, sitelink supports macsec provided the port and pop location support macsec encryption

question: is quality of service (qos) supported on sitelink-enabled virtual interfaces (vifs)?
answer: direct connect does not provide managed qos functionality

question: does sitelink support local preference bgp communities?
answer: yes, you can use existing aws direct connect local preference tags with sitelink

question: when should i use sitelink and when should i use aws cloud wan?
answer: depending on your use case, you might choose one, the other, or both

question: can i use the same private network connection with amazon virtual private cloud (vpc) and other aws services simultaneously?
answer: yes, each aws direct connect connection can be configured with one or more virtual interfaces

question: if i’m using amazon cloudfront and my origin is in my own data center, can i use aws direct connect to transfer the objects stored in my own data center?
answer: yes, amazon cloudfront supports custom origins including origins you run outside of aws

question: can i order a port for aws govcloud (us) in the aws management console?
answer: to order a port to connect to aws govcloud (us) you must use the aws govcloud (us) management console

question: what’s the max number of links i can have in a lag group?
answer: the maximum number of links is 4x in a lag group

question: are link aggregation groups (lag) in active/active or active/passive mode?
answer: they are in active/active

question: can the mtu of a lag change?
answer: the mtu of the lag can be changed

question: can i have my ports configured for active/passive instead of active/active?
answer: the lag at your endpoint can be configured with lacp active or passive modes

question: can i mix interface types and have a few 1g ports and a few 10g ports in the same lag?
answer: no, you can create lag using the same type of ports (either 1g or 10g)

question: what ports types will this be available on?
answer: it will be available for 1g, 10g, and 100g dedicated connection ports

question: can i lag hosted connections as well?
answer: no, it will only be available for 1g, 10g, and 100g dedicated connections

question: can i create a lag out of my existing ports?
answer: yes, if your ports are on the same direct connect device

question: can i have a lag that spans multiple aws direct connect devices?
answer: lag will only include ports on the same direct connect devices

question: how do i add links to my lag once it’s set up?
answer: you must request another port for your lag

question: you’re out of ports and i have to order a new lag, but i have virtual interfaces (vifs) configured! how do i move those?
answer: you can have multiple vifs attached to a vgw at once, and you can configure vifs on a connection even when it’s down

question: can i delete a single port from my lag?
answer: yes, but only if your min links are set to lower than the remaining ports

question: can i delete my lag all at once?
answer: yes, but just like a regular connection you won’t be able to delete it if you have vifs configured

question: can i order a lag with only one port?
answer: yes, please note we can’t promise that ports will be available on the same chassis if you want to add more ports in the future

question: can i convert a lag back to individual ports?
answer: yes, this can be done with the disassociateconnectionwithlag api call

question: can you create a tool to move my virtual interfaces (vifs) for me?
answer: you can use associatevirtualinterface api or console to do this operation

question: does the lag show as a single connection or a collection of connections?
answer: it will show as a single dxlag and we’ll list the connection id’s under it

question: what does min links mean, and why do i have a check box for it when i order my bundle?
answer: min links is a feature in lacp where you can set the minimum number of links that must be active in a bundle for that bundle to be active and pass traffic

question: when i associate my existing aws direct connect connection with a lag, what happens with virtual interfaces (vifs) already created with a connection?
answer: when a direct connect connection with existing virtual interfaces (vifs) is associated to a lag, virtual interfaces are migrated to the lag

question: can i set link priority on a specific link?
answer: we treat all links as equal, so we won’t set “link priority” on any specific link

question: can i have a 40ge interface on my side that connects to 4x 10ge on the aws side?
answer: to do this, you need 4x 10ge interfaces on your router to connect to aws a single 40ge interface connecting to a 4x 10ge lacp is not supported

question: are there any setup charges or a minimum service term commitment required to use aws direct connect?
answer: there are no setup charges, and you may cancel at any time

question: what connection speeds are available?
answer: for dedicated connections, 1 gbps, 10 gbps, and 100 gbps ports are available

question: are there limits on the amount of data that i can transfer using aws direct connect?
answer: no, you may transfer any amount of data up to the limit of your selected port capacity

question: are there limits on the number of routes i can advertise towards aws using aws direct connect?
answer: yes, you can advertise up to 100 routes over each border gateway protocol session using direct connect

question: what happens if i advertise more than 100 routes over a border gateway protocol session?
answer: your border gateway protocol session will go down if you advertise more than 100 routes over a border gateway protocol session

question: what are the technical requirements for the connection?
answer: direct connect supports 1000base-lx, 10gbase-lr, or 100gbase-lr4 connections over single mode fiber using ethernet transport

question: can i extend one of my vlans to the aws cloud using aws direct connect?
answer: no, vlans are used in direct connect only to separate traffic between virtual interfaces

question: what are the technical requirements for virtual interfaces to public aws services such as amazon ec2 and amazon s3?
answer: this connection requires the use of the border gateway protocol (bgp) with an autonomous system number (asn) and ip prefixes

question: what ip address will be assigned to each end of a virtual interface?
answer: if you are configuring a virtual interface to the public aws cloud, the ip addresses for both ends of the connection must be allocated from public ip space that you own

question: how do i enable bfd on my aws direct connect connection?
answer: asynchronous bfd is automatically enabled for each direct connect virtual interface, but will not take effect until it's configured on your router

question: how do i set up aws direct connect for the aws govcloud (us) region?
answer: see the aws govcloud (us) user guide for detailed instructions on setting up direct connect for use with the aws govcloud (us) region

question: can i establish a layer 2 connection between vpc and my network?
answer: no, layer 2 connections are not supported

question: can i use aws direct connect and a vpn connection to the same vpc simultaneously?
answer: yes, but only for failover

question: which aws regions offer aws direct connect support for aws transit gateway?
answer: support for transit gateway is available in all commercial aws regions

question: how do i create transit virtual interface?
answer: you can use the aws management console or api operations to create transit virtual interface

question: can i allocate transit virtual interface in another aws account?
answer: yes, you can allocate transit virtual interface in any aws account

question: can i attach transit virtual interface to my virtual private gateway?
answer: no, you cannot attach transit virtual interface to your virtual private gateway

question: can i attach private virtual interface to my aws transit gateway?
answer: no, you cannot attach private virtual interface to your aws transit gateway

question: what are the quotas associated with transit virtual interface?
answer: please refer to aws direct connect quotas page to learn more about the limits associated with transit virtual interface

question: can i add more transit virtual interfaces to the connection?
answer: no, you can create only one transit virtual interface for any aws direct connect connection of capacity greater than or equal to 1 gbps

question: i have an existing direct connect gateway attached to a private virtual interface, can i attach a transit virtual interface to this direct connect gateway?
answer: no, a direct connect gateway can only have one type of virtual interface attached

question: can i associate my aws transit gateway to the direct connect gateway attached to private virtual interface?
answer: no, an aws transit gateway can only be associated with the direct connect gateway attached to transit virtual interface

question: how long does it take to establish an association between aws transit gateway and aws direct connect gateway?
answer: it can take up to 40 minutes to establish an association between aws transit gateway and aws direct connect gateway

question: how many total virtual interfaces can i create per 1 gbps, 10 gbps, or 100 gbps dedicated connection?
answer: you can create up to 51 virtual interfaces per 1 gbps, 10 gbps, or 100 gbps dedicated connection inclusive of the transit virtual interface

question: can i create transit virtual interface on 1/2/5/10/100 gbps hosted connection?
answer: yes, you can create one transit virtual interface on any connection of capacity of 1 gbps or more (1, 2, 5, 10, 100 gbps)

question: i have 4x10 gbps lag, how many transit virtual interfaces can i create on this link aggregation group (lag)?
answer: you can create one transit virtual interface on the 4x10g lag

question: does a transit virtual interface support jumbo frames?
answer: yes, a transit virtual interface will support jumbo frames

question: do you support all the border gateway protocol (bgp) attributes that you support on the private virtual interface for the transit virtual interface?
answer: yes, you can continue to use supported bgp attributes (as_path, local pref, no_export) on the transit virtual interface

question: can i associate more than one aws transit gateway with an aws direct connect gateway?
answer: you can associate up to three transit gateway to a direct connect gateway as long as the ip cidr blocks announced from your transit gateways do not overlap

question: can i associate vpcs owned by any aws account with an aws direct connect gateway owned by any aws account?
answer: yes, you can associate vpcs owned by any aws account with a direct connect gateway owned by any aws account

question: can i associate aws transit gateway that are owned by any aws account with an aws direct connect gateway that is owned by any aws account?
answer: yes, you can associate a transit gateway owned by any aws account with a direct connect gateway owned by any aws account

question: if i use an aws direct connect gateway, does my traffic to the desired aws region go by way of the associated home aws region?
answer: no, when using direct connect gateway, your traffic will take the shortest path to and from your direct connect location to the destination aws region, regardless of the associated home aws region of the direct connect location where you are connected

question: are there additional fees when using aws direct connect gateway and working with remote aws regions?
answer: there are no charges for using a direct connect gateway

question: do i need to use the same aws account with my private/transit virtual interfaces(s), aws direct connect gateway, virtual private gateway, or aws transit gateways in order to use an aws direct connect gateway?
answer: private virtual interfaces and direct connect gateways must be in the same aws account

question: i am working with an aws direct connect partner to get private virtual interface (vif) provisioned for my account, can i use an aws direct connect gateway?
answer: yes, you can associate a provisioned private virtual interface (vif) with your direct connect gateway when you confirm that you are provisioned as private in your aws account

question: can i connect to vpcs in my local region?
answer: you can continue to attach your virtual interfaces (vifs) to virtual private gateways (vgws)

question: what are the quotas associated with an aws direct connect gateway?
answer: please refer to the direct connect quotas page for information on this topic

question: can virtual private gateways (vgws, associated with a vpc) be part of more than one aws direct connect gateway?
answer: no, a vgw-vpc pair cannot be part of more than one direct connect gateway

question: can you attach a private virtual interface (vif) to more than one aws direct connect gateway?
answer: no, one private virtual interface can only attach to one direct connect gateway or one virtual private gateway

question: does aws direct connect gateway break existing aws vpn cloudhub functionality?
answer: no, direct connect gateway does not break aws vpn cloudhub

question: what type of traffic is, and is not, supported by aws direct connect gateway?
answer: please refer to direct connect user guide to review supported and not supported traffic patterns

question: i currently have a vpn in us-east-1 attached to a virtual private gateway (vgw). i want to use aws vpn cloudhub in us-east-1 between the vpn and a new vif. can i do this with aws direct connect gateway?
answer: no, you cannot do this with a direct connect gateway, but the option to attach a vif directly to a vgw is available to use the vpn <-> direct connect aws vpn cloudhub use case

question: i have created an aws direct connect gateway with one aws direct connect private vif, and three non-overlapping virtual private gateways (vgws) -- each associated with a vpc. what happens if i detach one of the vgw from the vpc?
answer: traffic from your on-premises network to the detached vpc will stop, and vgw's association with the direct connect gateway will be deleted

question: i have created an aws direct connect gateway with one aws direct connect vif, and three non-overlapping vgw-vpc pairs, what happens if i detach one of the virtual private gateways (vgw) from the aws direct connect gateway?
answer: traffic from your on-premises network to the detached vgw (associated with a vpc) will stop

question: can i send traffic from a vpc that is associated with an aws direct connect gateway to another vpc associated to the same aws direct connect gateway?
answer: no, direct connect gateway's only support routing traffic from direct connect vifs to vgw (associated with vpc)

question: can i resize a vpc that is associated with an aws direct connect gateway?
answer: yes, you can resize the vpc

question: is there a way to configure an aws direct connect gateway to selectively propagate prefixes to/from vpcs?
answer: yes, direct connect gateway offers a way for you to selectively announce prefixes towards your on-premises networks

question: can i use this feature for my existing ebgp sessions?
answer: yes, all existing bgp sessions on private virtual interfaces support the use of local preference communities

question: will this feature be available on both public and private virtual interfaces?
answer: no, this feature is currently available for private and transit virtual interfaces only

question: will this feature work with an aws direct connect gateway?
answer: yes, this feature will work with private virtual interfaces attached with direct connect gateway

question: can i verify that communities are being received by aws?
answer: no, at this time we do not provide such monitoring features

question: what are the supported local preference communities for an aws direct connect private virtual interface?
answer: the following communities are supported for private virtual interface and are evaluated in order of lowest to highest preference

question: what is the default behavior, in case i do not use the supported communities?
answer: if you do not specify local preference communities for your private vif, the default local preference is based on the distance to the direct connect locations from the local region

question: i have two private vifs on a physical connection at an aws direct connect location; can i use supported communities to influence egress behavior across these two private vifs?
answer: yes, you can use this feature to influence egress traffic behavior between two vifs on the same physical connection

question: does the local preference communities feature support failover?
answer: yes, this can be accomplished by advertising prefixes over the primary/active virtual interface with a community for higher local preference than prefixes advertised over the backup/passive virtual interface

question: i have already configured my routers with as_path, do i need to change the configuration to use community tags and disrupt my network?
answer: no, we will continue to respect as_path attribute

question: i have two aws direct connect connections, one is 1 gbps and another is 10 gbps, and both are advertising the same prefix. i would like to receive all traffic for this destination across the 10 gbps direct connect connection, but still be able to failover to the 1 gbps connection. can local preference communities be used to balance traffic in this scenario?
answer: yes, by marking the prefix advertised over the 10 gbps direct connection with a community of a higher local preference, it will be the preferred path

question: how wide will aws multipath traffic to my network?
answer: we will multipath per prefix at up to 16 next-hops wide, where each next-hop is a unique aws endpoint

question: can i have v4 and v6 bgp sessions running over a single vpn tunnel?
answer: at this time, we only allow v4 bgp session running single vpn tunnel with ipv4 address

question: is there any difference to the bgp configuration/setup details outlined for aws direct connect?
answer: vpn bgp will work the same as direct connect

question: can i terminate my tunnel to an endpoint with an ipv6 address?
answer: at this time, we only support ipv4 endpoint address for vpn

question: what is this feature?
answer: configurable private autonomous system number (asn)

question: where are these features available?
answer: all commercial aws regions (except aws china region) and aws govcloud (us)

question: how can i configure/assign my asn to be advertised as the aws side asn?
answer: you can configure/assign an asn to be advertised as the aws side asn during creation of the new direct connect gateway

question: can i use any asn - public and private?
answer: you can assign any private asn to the aws side

question: why can't i assign a public asn for the aws half of the bgp session?
answer: aws is not validating ownership of the asns, therefore we're limiting the aws side asn to private asns

question: what asn can i choose?
answer: you can choose any private asn

question: what will happen if i try to assign a public asn to the aws half of the bgp session?
answer: we will ask you to re-enter a private asn once you attempt to create the direct connect gateway

question: if i don't provide an asn for the aws half of the bgp session, what asn can i expect from aws?
answer: aws will provide an asn of 64512 for the direct connect gateway if you don't choose one

question: where can i view the aws side asn?
answer: you can view the aws side asn in the direct connect console and in the response of the describedirectconnectgateways or describevirtualinterfaces api operations

question: if i have a public asn, will it work with a private asn on the aws side?
answer: yes, you can configure the aws side of the bgp session with a private asn and your side with a public asn

question: i have private vifs already configured and want to set a different aws side asn for the bgp session on an existing vif. how can i make this change?
answer: you must create a new direct connect gateway with desired asn, and create a new vif with the newly created direct connect gateway

question: i'm attaching multiple private vifs to a single aws direct connect gateway. can each vif have a separate aws side asn?
answer: no, you can assign/configure separate aws side asn for each direct connect gateway, not each vif

question: can i use different private asns for my aws direct connect gateway and virtual private gateway?
answer: yes, you can use different private asns for your direct connect gateway and virtual private gateway

question: can i use same private asns for my aws direct connect gateway and virtual private gateway?
answer: yes, you can use same private asns for your direct connect gateway and virtual private gateway

question: i'm attaching multiple virtual private gateways with their own private asn to a single aws direct connect gateway configured with its own private asn. which private asn takes precedence, vgw or aws direct connect gateway?
answer: direct connect gateway private asn will be used as the aws side asn for the border gateway protocol (bgp) session between your network and aws

question: how am i charged for using s3 glacier deep archive?
answer: s3 glacier deep archive storage is priced based on the amount of data you store in gbs, the number of put/lifecycle transition requests, retrievals in gbs, and number of restore requests

question: how will s3 glacier deep archive usage show up on my aws bill and in the aws cost management tool?
answer: s3 glacier deep archive usage and cost will show up as an independent service line item on your monthly aws bill, separate from your amazon s3 usage and costs

question: are there minimum storage duration and minimum object storage charges for s3 glacier deep archive?
answer: s3 glacier deep archive is designed for long-lived but rarely accessed data that is retained for 7-10 years or more

question: how does s3 glacier deep archive integrate with other aws services?
answer: s3 glacier deep archive is integrated with amazon s3 features including, s3 object tagging, s3 lifecycle policies, s3 object lock, and s3 replication

question: what is amazon s3 on outposts?
answer: amazon s3 on outposts delivers object storage in your on-premises environment, using the s3 apis and capabilities that you use in aws today

question: what are s3 object tags?
answer: s3 object tags are key-value pairs applied to s3 objects which can be created, updated or deleted at any time during the lifetime of the object

question: why should i use object tags?
answer: object tags are a tool you can use to enable simple management of your s3 storage

question: how much do object tags cost?
answer: object tags are priced based on the quantity of tags and a request cost for adding tags

question: how do i get started with storage class analysis?
answer: you can use the aws management console or the s3 put bucket analytics api to configure a storage class analysis policy to identify infrequently accessed storage that can be transitioned to the s3 standard-ia or s3 one zone-ia storage class or archived to the s3 glacier storage classes

question: what is s3 inventory?
answer: the s3 inventory report provides a scheduled alternative to amazon s3’s synchronous list api

question: how do i get started with s3 inventory?
answer: you can use the aws management console or the put bucket inventory configuration api to configure a daily or weekly inventory report for all the objects within your s3 bucket or a subset of the objects under a shared prefix

question: how am i charged for using s3 inventory?
answer: please see the amazon s3 pricing page for s3 inventory pricing

question: what is amazon s3 object lock?
answer: amazon s3 object lock is an amazon s3 feature that prevents an object version from being deleted or overwritten for a fixed amount of time or indefinitely,  so that you can enforce retention policies as an added layer of data protection or for regulatory compliance

question: how does amazon s3 object lock work?
answer: amazon s3 object lock prevents deletion of an object version for the duration of a specified retention period or indefinitely until a legal hold is removed

question: what aws documentation supports the sec 17a-4(f)(2)(i) and cftc 1.31(c) requirement for notifying my regulator?
answer: provide notification to your regulator or “designated examining authority (dea)” of your choice to use amazon s3 for electronic storage along with a copy of the cohasset assessment

question: what is s3 lifecycle management?
answer: s3 lifecycle management provides the ability to define the lifecycle of your object with a predefined policy and reduce your cost of storage

question: how do i set up an s3 lifecycle management policy?
answer: you can set up and manage lifecycle policies in the aws management console, s3 rest api, aws sdks, or aws command line interface (cli)

question: how can i use amazon s3 lifecycle management to help lower my amazon s3 storage costs?
answer: with amazon s3 lifecycle policies, you can configure your objects to be migrated to from the s3 standard storage class to s3 standard-ia or s3 one zone-ia and/or archived to s3 glacier instant retrieval, s3 glacier flexible retrieval, or s3 glacier deep archive storage classes

question: why would i use an s3 lifecycle policy to expire incomplete multipart uploads?
answer: the s3 lifecycle policy that expires incomplete multipart uploads allows you to save on costs by limiting the time non-completed multipart uploads are stored

question: can i set up amazon s3 event notifications to send notifications when s3 lifecycle transitions or expires objects?
answer: yes, you can set up amazon s3 event notifications to notify you when s3 lifecycle transitions or expires objects

question: what features are available to analyze my storage usage on amazon s3?
answer: s3 storage lens delivers organization-wide visibility into object storage usage, activity trends, and makes actionable recommendations to improve cost-efficiency and apply data protection best practices

question: what is amazon s3 storage lens?
answer: amazon s3 storage lens provides organization-wide visibility into object storage usage and activity trends, as well as actionable recommendations to improve cost efficiency and apply data protection best practices

question: how does s3 storage lens work?
answer: s3 storage lens aggregates your storage usage and activity metrics on a daily basis to be visualized in the s3 storage lens interactive dashboard, or available as a metrics export in cvs or parquet file format

question: what metrics are available in s3 storage lens?
answer: s3 storage lens contains more than 30 metrics, grouped by usage metrics (resulting from a daily snapshot of objects in the account) and activity metrics (which track requests and bytes retrieved)

question: how much historical data is available in s3 storage lens?
answer: for metrics displayed in the interactive dashboard, storage lens free metrics retains 14-days of historical data, and the advanced metrics and recommendations retains 15-months of historical data

question: what is the difference between s3 storage lens and s3 inventory?
answer: s3 inventory provides a list of your objects and their corresponding metadata for an s3 bucket or a shared prefix, which can be used to perform object-level analysis of your storage

question: what is the difference between s3 storage lens and s3 storage class analysis (sca)?
answer: s3 storage class analysis provides recommendations for an optimal storage class by creating object age groups based on object-level access patterns within an individual bucket/prefix/tag for the previous 30-90 days

question: what is storage class analysis?
answer: with storage class analysis, you can analyze storage access patterns to determine the optimal storage class for your storage

question: how often is the storage class analysis updated?
answer: storage class analysis is updated on a daily basis in the s3 management console, but initial recommendations for storage class transitions are provided after 30 days

question: what is s3 select?
answer: s3 select is an amazon s3 feature that makes it easy to retrieve specific data from the contents of an object using simple sql expressions without having to retrieve the entire object

question: what is amazon redshift spectrum?
answer: amazon redshift spectrum is a feature of amazon redshift that enables you to run queries against exabytes of unstructured data in amazon s3 with no loading or etl required

question: what is amazon s3 replication?
answer: amazon s3 replication enables automatic, asynchronous copying of objects across amazon s3 buckets

question: what is amazon s3 cross-region replication (crr)?
answer: crr is an amazon s3 feature that automatically replicates data between buckets across different aws regions

question: what is amazon s3 same-region replication (srr)?
answer: srr is an amazon s3 feature that automatically replicates data between buckets within the same aws region

question: how do i enable amazon s3 replication (cross-region replication and same-region replication)?
answer: amazon s3 replication (crr and srr) is configured at the s3 bucket level, a shared prefix level, or an object level using s3 object tags

question: can i use s3 replication (crr and srr) with s3 lifecycle rules?
answer: with s3 replication (crr and srr), you can establish replication rules to make copies of your objects into another storage class, in the same or a different region

question: can i use replication across aws accounts to protect against malicious or accidental deletion?
answer: yes, for crr and srr, you can set up replication across aws accounts to store your replicated data in a different account in the target region

question: will my object tags be replicated if i use cross-region replication?
answer: object tags can be replicated across aws regions using cross-region replication

question: can i replicate delete markers from one bucket to another?
answer: yes, you can replicate delete markers from source to destination if you have delete marker replication enabled in your replication configuration

question: can i replicate data from other aws regions to china? can a customer replicate from one china region bucket outside of china regions?
answer: no, amazon s3 replication is not available between aws china regions and aws regions outside of china

question: what is the pricing for cross account data replication?
answer: with s3 replication, you can configure cross account replication where the source and destination buckets are owned by different aws accounts

question: what is amazon s3 replication time control?
answer: amazon s3 replication time control provides predictable replication performance and helps you meet compliance or business requirements

question: how do i enable amazon s3 replication time control?
answer: amazon s3 replication time control is enabled as an option for each replication rule

question: what are amazon s3 replication metrics and events?
answer: amazon s3 replication metrics and events provide visibility into amazon s3 replication

question: how do i enable amazon s3 replication metrics and events?
answer: amazon s3 replication metrics and events can be enabled for each new or existing replication rules, and are enabled by default for s3 replication time control enabled rules

question: what is the amazon s3 replication time control service level agreement (sla)?
answer: amazon s3 replication time control is designed to replicate 99

question: what is the pricing for s3 replication and s3 replication time control?
answer: for s3 replication (cross-region replication and same region replication), you pay the s3 charges for storage in the selected destination s3 storage classes, the storage charges for the primary copy, replication put requests, and applicable infrequent access storage retrieval charges

question: how is s3 transfer acceleration different than s3 multi-region access points?
answer: you can use s3 transfer acceleration to speed up content transfers to and from a single centralized s3 bucket using the aws global network

question: what is s3 object lambda?
answer: s3 object lambda allows you to add your own code to s3 get requests to modify and process data as it is returned to an application

question: why should i use s3 object lambda?
answer: you should use s3 object lambda to share a single copy of your data across many applications, avoiding the need to build and operate custom processing infrastructure or to store derivative copies of your data

question: how does s3 object lambda work?
answer: s3 object lambda uses lambda functions specified by you to process the output of a standard get request

question: how do i get started with s3 object lambda?
answer: s3 object lambda can be set up in multiple ways

question: what kinds of operations can i perform with s3 object lambda?
answer: any operation supported in a lambda function is supported with s3 object lambda

question: which s3 request types does s3 object lambda support?
answer: s3 object lambda supports get requests

question: what will happen when a s3 object lambda function fails?
answer: when a s3 object lambda function fails, you will receive a request response detailing the failure

question: does s3 object lambda affect the s3 availability sla or s3 durability?
answer: s3 object lambda connects amazon s3, aws lambda, and optionally, other aws services of your choosing to deliver objects relevant to requesting applications

question: how much does s3 object lambda cost?
answer: when you use s3 object lambda, you pay a per gb charge for every gigabyte of data returned to you through s3 object lambda

question: what are serverless applications?
answer: serverless applications eliminate the need to provision, deploy, or manage servers or other infrastructure

answer: the aws serverless application repository offers a growing collection of serverless applications published by aws and other aws partners and developers

question: how are applications in the aws serverless application repository licensed?

answer: all applications published by aws are vetted for license adherence and code quality

question: how do i publish a serverless application to the aws serverless application repository?

answer: with a hierarchy of nested applications, each nested application has to be made available to the aws account with whom you are sharing the top-level application

question: what is amazon lightsail?

question: what are the lightsail service quotas?

question: what operating systems can i use with amazon lightsail?

question: what do lightsail static ips cost?

question: how can i pay my lightsail bill?

answer: you can attach up to 15 disks per lightsail instance

question: does lightsail block storage offer encryption?

question: what availability can i expect from lightsail block storage?
answer: lightsail block storage is designed to be highly available and reliable

question: how do i back up my attached disk?

question: how are attached disks different than the storage included in my lightsail plan?

question: what can i do with lightsail load balancers?
answer: lightsail load balancers allow you to build highly available websites and applications

question: can i use load balancers with instances in different aws regions or different availability zones?
answer: you cannot use load balancers with instances running in different aws regions

question: how does my lightsail load balancer deal with traffic spikes?
answer: lightsail load balancers scale automatically to handle traffic spikes to your application without you having to manually adjust them

question: how do lightsail load balancers route traffic to my target instances?
answer: lightsail load balancers direct traffic to your healthy target instances based on a round robin algorithm

question: how does lightsail know if my target instances are healthy?
answer: during load balancer creation, you will be asked to specify a path (a common file or webpage url) for lightsail to ping

question: can i assign one instance to multiple load balancers?

question: what kind of connections do lightsail load balancers support?

question: how can i use lightsail-provisioned certificates?
answer: ssl/tls certificates are used to establish the identity of your website or application and secure connections between browsers and your website

question: how do i validate my certificate?
answer: lightsail certificates are domain validated, meaning that you need to provide proof of identity by validating that you own or have access to your website’s domain before the certificate can be provisioned by the certificate authority

question: what happens if i cannot validate my domain?
answer: you must be able to validate that you own a domain for security purposes

question: how many domains and subdomains can i add to my certificate?
answer: you can add up to 10 domains or subdomains per certificate

question: how can i change the domains associated with my certificate?
answer: to change the domains (add/delete) associated with your certificate, you will need to resubmit the certificate and revalidate your ownership of the domain(s)

question: how do i renew my certificate?
answer: lightsail provides managed renewal for your ssl/tls certificates

question: what happens to my certificate when i delete my load balancer?
answer: if your load balancer is deleted, your certificate is deleted as well

question: can i download my certificate provided by lightsail?
answer: no, lightsail certificates are bound to your lightsail account and cannot be removed and used outside of lightsail

question: what is upgrade to ec2?
answer: upgrade to ec2 is a feature that allows you to create a copy of your lightsail instance in amazon ec2

question: why would i want to upgrade to ec2?

question: how does it work?

question: how am i billed?
answer: using the upgrade to ec2 feature is free

question: can i export managed database or disk snapshots?
answer: the upgrade feature allows you to export lightsail disk manual snapshots but doesn't currently support managed database snapshots

question: what lightsail resources can i upgrade?
answer: lightsail's upgrade to ec2 feature is designed to support the export of linux and windows instances and their attached block storage (if applicable) to ec2

question: what are lightsail's managed databases?
answer: lightsail's managed databases are instances that are dedicated to running databases, instead of other workloads like webserver, mail server, etc

question: what can i do with lightsail's managed databases?
answer: lightsail managed databases provide an easy, low maintenance way to store your data in the cloud

question: what does lightsail manage for me on my managed database?
answer: lightsail manages a range of maintenance activities and security for your database and its underlying infrastructure

question: what managed database plans does lightsail offer?
answer: lightsail offers 4 sizes of databases in standard and high availability plans

question: what is a high availability plan?
answer: managed databases are available in standard and high availability plans

question: how do i scale up or down my managed database?
answer: you can scale up your database by taking a snapshot of your database and creating a new, larger database plan from snapshot or by creating a new, larger database using the emergency restore feature

question: how can i back up my managed database?
answer: lightsail backs up your data automatically and allows restore of this data from a specific point in time to a new database

question: what happens to my data if i delete my managed database?
answer: if you delete your managed database, both your database itself and all automatic backups will be deleted

question: how do managed databases work with my lightsail instances?
answer: after you create your managed database, you can start using your database with your application immediately, using your lightsail instances as web servers or other dedicated workloads for your app

question: what can i do with lightsail cdn distributions?
answer: lightsail content delivery network (cdn) distributions make it easy for you to accelerate the delivery of content hosted on your lightsail resources by storing and serving it on amazon’s global delivery network, powered by amazon cloudfront

answer: lightsail distributions allow you to use your lightsail instances and load balancers as origins

question: is there a limit to the number of certificates i can create?

answer: lightsail distributions automatically redirect all http requests to https to ensure that your content is served securely

question: how do i know if my distribution is working?

question: how is lightsail cdn intended to be used?

answer: aws storage gateway is a hybrid cloud storage service that gives you on-premises access to virtually unlimited cloud storage

question: what use cases does aws storage gateway support?
answer: storage gateway supports four key hybrid cloud use cases – (1) move backups and archives to the cloud, (2) reduce on-premises storage with cloud-backed file shares, (3) provide on-premises applications low latency access to data stored in aws, and (4) data lake access for pre and post processing workflows

question: where can i deploy a storage gateway appliance?
answer: on-premises, you can deploy a virtual machine containing the storage gateway software on vmware esxi, microsoft hyper-v, or linux kvm, or you can deploy storage gateway as a hardware appliance

question: what is amazon s3 file gateway?
answer: amazon s3 file gateway presents a file-based interface to amazon s3, which appears as a network file share

question: what is amazon fsx file gateway?
answer: amazon fsx file gateway optimizes on-premises access to windows file shares on amazon fsx, making it easy for users to access fsx for windows file server data with low latency and conserving shared bandwidth

question: what is tape gateway?
answer: tape gateway is a cloud-based virtual tape library (vtl)

question: what is volume gateway?
answer: volume gateway provides an iscsi target, which enables you to create block storage volumes and mount them as iscsi devices from your on-premises or ec2 application servers

question: what benefits does aws storage gateway provide?
answer: aws storage gateway provides a set of features that enable you to effectively leverage aws storage within your existing applications and workflows

question: what aws storage gateway types can i manage through aws backup?
answer: you can manage backup and retention policies for cached and stored volume modes of volume gateway through aws backup

question: what is the maximum supported size of the local cache per gateway?

question: what are the benefits of using file gateway to store data in s3?
answer: amazon s3 file gateway enables your existing file-based applications, devices, and workflows to use amazon s3, without modification

question: which amazon s3 storage classes does s3 file gateway support?
answer: amazon s3 file gateway supports amazon s3 standard, s3 intelligent-tiering, s3 standard - infrequent access (s3 standard-ia) and s3 one zone-ia

question: what protocols does amazon s3 file gateway support?
answer: amazon s3 file gateway supports linux clients connecting to the gateway using network file system (nfs) versions 3 and 4

question: how can i create and use a file share?

question: what options do i have to configure an nfs file share?

question: what options do i have to configure an smb file share?

question: does amazon s3 file gateway support access-based enumeration for smb file shares?

question: does amazon s3 file gateway support integration with on-premises microsoft active directory (ad)?

question: can i export an smb file share without active directory?

question: can i export a mix of nfs and smb file shares on the same gateway?

question: can i export an nfs and smb file share on the same bucket?
answer: no, currently file metadata, such as ownership, stored as s3 object metadata cannot be mapped across different protocols

question: how does amazon s3 file gateway access my s3 bucket?
answer: amazon s3 file gateway uses an aws identity and access management (iam) role to access your s3 bucket

question: how does my application access my file share?
answer: to use the file share, you mount it from your application using standard unix or windows commands

question: how is my file share mapped to my s3 bucket?
answer: the file share can be mapped to the root of the s3 bucket or it can be mapped to a s3 prefix within a s3 bucket

question: can i give my file share a custom name?

question: can i change my file share name?

question: what is the relationship between files and objects?

question: what file system operations are supported by amazon s3 file gateway?
answer: your clients can create, read, update, and delete, files and directories

question: what file system metadata can my client access and where is the metadata stored?
answer: your clients can access posix-style metadata including ownership, permissions, and timestamps that are durably stored in s3 in the user metadata of the object associated with the file

question: how do i set the content-type for files uploaded to s3?
answer: for each file share, you can enable guessing of mime types for uploaded objects upon creation or enable the feature later

question: can i directly access objects stored in s3 by using amazon s3 file gateway?
answer: yes, once objects are stored in s3, you can access them directly in aws for in-cloud workloads without requiring amazon s3 file gateway

question: what if my bucket already contains objects?
answer: if your bucket already contains objects when you configure it for use with amazon s3 file gateway, object keys will be used to present the objects as files to the nfs and smb clients

question: how are buckets accessed by the gateway? are entire bucket or file contents downloaded?
answer: the gateway does not automatically download full objects or all the data that exists in your bucket; data is only downloaded when it is explicitly accessed by your clients

question: what metadata can my nfs client access for objects created outside of the gateway?
answer: for objects uploaded to the s3 bucket directly, i

question: can i use multiple nfs clients with a single amazon s3 file gateway?

question: can i have multiple writers to my s3 bucket?
answer: no, we recommend a single writer to objects in your s3 bucket

question: can i have two gateways writing independent data to the same bucket?
answer: we do not recommend configuring multiple writers to a single bucket because it can lead to unpredictable results

question: can i have multiple gateways reading data from the same bucket?
answer: yes, you can have multiple readers on a bucket managed through an amazon s3 file gateway

question: can i monitor my file share using amazon cloudwatch?
answer: yes, you can monitor usage of your file share using amazon cloudwatch metrics and get notified on completion of file operations through cloudwatch events

question: how do i know when my file is uploaded?
answer: when you write files to your file share with amazon s3 file gateway, the data is stored locally first and then asynchronously uploaded to your s3 bucket

question: how is a file upload notification different from an s3 event notification?
answer: the file upload notification provides a notification for each individual file that is uploaded to amazon s3 through s3 file gateway

question: can i update my amazon s3 file gateway’s view of a bucket to see objects created from an object-based workload or another file gateway?

question: can i use the gateway to update data in a bucket that belongs to another aws account?
answer: yes, you can use the gateway for cross-account access to buckets

question: can i use the gateway to access data in requester pays s3 buckets?
answer: yes, when creating your file share you can enable access to requester pays s3 buckets

question: how do i create multiple shares per bucket in a gateway?
answer: you can create multiple file shares for a single s3 bucket by specifying a s3 prefix during file share creation process

question: how many file shares can i create per gateway?
answer: you can create up to 10 shares for a s3 bucket in a single gateway

question: can i change the name of a file share?
answer: yes, you can change the name of a file share

question: what is the maximum size of an individual file?
answer: the maximum size of an individual file is 5 tb, which is the maximum size of an individual object in s3

question: my application checks storage size before copying data. what storage size does the gateway return?
answer: the gateway returns a large number (8 eb) as your total capacity

question: can i use amazon s3 lifecycle, cross-region replication, and s3 event notification with file gateway?

question: can i use amazon s3 file gateway with my backup application?
answer: amazon s3 file gateway supports smb versions 2 and 3 as well as nfs versions 3, 4

question: can i use amazon s3 file gateway to write files to efs?
answer: no, amazon s3 file gateway allows you to store files as objects in s3

question: when should i use amazon s3 file gateway vs. the s3 api?
answer: you can use amazon s3 file gateway when you want to access objects in s3 as files using standard filesystem operations

question: how does amazon s3 file gateway manage the local cache? what data gets stored locally?
answer: local disk storage on the gateway is used to temporarily hold changed data that needs to be transferred to aws, and to locally cache data for low-latency read access

question: when does data in the cache get evicted?
answer: data written to the cache from your applications or through retrieval from amazon s3 is evicted from the cache only when space is needed to store more recently accessed data

question: does amazon s3 file gateway perform data reduction (deduplication or compression)?
answer: no, files are mapped to objects one-to-one in your bucket without modification, enabling you to access your data directly in s3 without needing to use the gateway or deploy additional software to rehydrate your data

question: can i use amazon s3 file gateway with amazon s3 transfer acceleration?
answer: file gateway will not use the accelerated endpoints even if your bucket is configured for s3 transfer acceleration

question: what sort of encryption does amazon s3 file gateway use to protect my data?
answer: all data transferred between the gateway and aws storage is encrypted using ssl

question: why should i use amazon fsx file gateway?
answer: many on-premises desktop applications are latency-sensitive, which may cause delays to your end users and slow performance when they are directly accessing files in aws from remote locations

question: how do i use amazon fsx file gateway?
answer: to use amazon fsx file gateway, you need to have at least one running amazon fsx file system, and ensure that you have on-premises access to amazon fsx for windows file server either through a vpn or through an aws direct connect connection

question: what regions is amazon fsx file gateway available in?
answer: amazon fsx file gateway can be used to access windows file systems in all aws regions where fsx for windows file server is offered

question: how much does amazon fsx file gateway cost?
answer: you are billed hourly for amazon fsx file gateway

question: what protocols does amazon fsx file gateway support?
answer: amazon fsx file gateway supports versions 2

question: what is the relationship between files i see in amazon fsx file gateway and files i see in amazon fsx for windows file server?
answer: amazon fsx file gateway maps local file shares and their contents to file shares stored remotely in amazon fsx for windows file server

question: does amazon fsx file gateway allow me to access the same file shares in aws?

question: how does amazon fsx file gateway allow me to manage my amazon fsx for windows file server?

question: can amazon fsx file gateway be connected to more than one amazon fsx for windows file system?

question: what deployment options are supported?

question: how do i use my active directory to provide credentials?

question: is amazon fsx file gateway compatible with my existing windows access controls and active directory credentials?

question: how does amazon fsx file gateway provide high availability?

question: what types of failures are covered by amazon fsx file gateway with high availability?

question: how many sessions and file shares does amazon fsx file gateway support?

question: what are the benefits of storing virtual tapes in aws compared to warehousing tapes offsite?

question: what amazon s3 storage classes does tape gateway support?
answer: tape gateway supports s3 standard, s3 glacier, and s3 glacier deep archive storage classes

question: how much data can i store on a virtual tape?
answer: the minimum size and maximum size of a virtual tape you can create on a tape gateway is 100 gib and 5 tib respectively

question: how many tapes can the virtual tape library (vtl) hold?

question: how much data can i store in tape archives?

answer: no, you cannot move a tape from s3 glacier deep archive to s3 glacier

question: how much volume data can i manage per gateway? what is the maximum size of a volume?

question: can i create a volume from kms-encrypted ebs snapshot?

answer: you can take point-in-time snapshots of your volume gateway volumes in the form of amazon ebs snapshots

question: will i be able to access my snapshot data using amazon s3’s apis?
answer: no, snapshots are only accessible from the aws storage gateway and amazon ebs and cannot be directly accessed using amazon s3 apis

answer: there are no limits to the number of snapshots or the amount of snapshot data a single gateway can produce

question: if i use aws backup, can i also continue to use volume gateway snapshot schedules and existing snapshots?

question: what is the storage gateway hardware appliance?

question: why might i need a hardware appliance?

question: how does storage gateway provide high availability?

question: what environments are enabled for storage gateway high availability?

question: what types of failures are covered by storage gateway with high availability?

question: will gateway reads or writes fail during a gateway restart?

question: will storage gateway ha still have the ability to restart if its connection to aws is broken?

question: will i lose data during a gateway restart?

question: what does storage gateway ha give me that i don't already have if i operate vmware ha?

question: will this be available for vmware cloud on aws?

question: how will i know if a gateway is capable of high availability and operating in ha-mode?

question: what encryption does aws storage gateway use to protect my data?

question: is aws storage gateway hipaa eligible?

question: is aws storage gateway pci compliant?

question: is aws storage gateway fedramp compliant?

question: does aws storage gateway support fips 140-2 compliant endpoints?

question: what are the fips endpoints for aws storage gateway?

question: does tape gateway support write once read many (worm) capability?

question: can i use aws storage gateway with aws direct connect?

question: can i route my aws storage gateway internet traffic through a local proxy server?

question: can i deploy a storage gateway on my private non-routable network? does storage gateway support aws privatelink?

question: does storage gateway support aws privatelink for all types of gateways?

question: what performance can i expect?

question: what are the minimum hardware and software requirements for the aws storage gateway?

question: what type of data reduction does aws storage gateway perform?

question: how do i monitor my gateway?

question: how can i measure the cache performance of my gateway?

question: how can i create cloudwatch alarms for my gateway?

question: how does the aws storage gateway manage updates?
answer: aws storage gateway periodically deploys important updates and software patches to your gateway virtual machine (vm)

question: how will i be charged for file storage when using a file gateway?
answer: file gateways stores data directly in amazon s3

question: how will i be charged for volume or virtual tape storage when using a volume or tape gateway?

question: how will i be charged for ebs snapshots taken from my aws storage gateway volumes?

question: how will i be charged for reading and writing data?

question: how will i be charged when retrieving data on an archived virtual tape?

question: how will i be charged for deleting an archived virtual tape?

question: how am i charged for virtual tapes i store in s3 glacier deep archive?

question: how will the virtual tapes i store in deep archive pool, associated with s3 glacier deep archive storage class, show up on my aws bill and in the aws cost management tool?
